comments.body: Add a unit test in a situation where periodicValue is not called in a timely fashion i.e. frequency varies up and down

This is a pure function disguised as a class member method. You can only use it if you have an instance of `ConsumptionSpeedMetric` which is kind of strange, since you don't actually need an instance of anything since it doesn't depend on the context.
The `def finalValue()` method is a pure function in some metrics, but there are others that implement the function using their internal state. That's why it's a part of `Metric` trait.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +18,22 @@
      val (_, periodicValue) = metric.periodicValue()
      val finalValue = metric.finalValue(1.0)

      periodicValue shouldBe ConsumptionSpeedMetric.Value(Some(0.0))
